body:
Comment 9 by **jp@webmaster.ms**: 
I found that r2 is used to return EDX on linux/386 and darwin/386.
Only windows always have 0 in r2.

Perhaps it is worth to ask in the mailing-list if the people interesting in the
possibility of adding r3 to return ST(0) on 386 and xmm0 on amd64 in order to cover all
the cases with DLL calls and to avoid returning to the topic when somebody will have
such a DLL.
